comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of May 25, 1913 describes the plans for the unveiling of the monument to the Maine. The Cuba was the naval representative of the Cuban government. See query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A01E2D8103BE633A...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
7471115@N08
comment._content: According to Conway's All the World's Fighting Ships, the Cuba was a sloop displacing 2055 tons, and was 260' long x 39' in beam. Built in 1911 at the Cramp shipyard in Philadelphia, she was reconstructed at some point and served until 1971! Armament consisted of 2 x 4", 4 x 6pdr, 4 x 3 pdr, and her top speed was 18 knots.
